item.title: Narrated Bus Tour of Bar Harbor and Acadia National Park
item.description: Take a deep dive into Bar Harbor, Acadia National Park, and Mt. Desert Island on this half-day bus tour. Since your transportation is provided, you can focus on the scenery and taking in the insightful narrative instead of driving and directions. Make three stops within the town of Bar Harbor and the National Park to witness firsthand the views and wildlife that make this island so special. Stops include Cadillac Mountain, Sieur de Monts Spring, and Thunder Hole.

image.alt: Narrated Bus Tour of Bar Harbor and Acadia National Park

item.title: The Real Portland Tour: City and 3 Lighthouses Historical Tour with a Real Local
item.description: Explore the heart of Portland and head out to see some of the area's hidden gems and less-visited spots with this guided sightseeing tour. Your guide, a born-and-raised Portlander who works as a college librarian by day, shows you off-the-beaten-path locations and shares with you all sorts of local lore along the way.

image.alt: The Real Portland Tour: City and 3 Lighthouses Historical Tour with a Real Local

item.title: Vintage Fire Truck Sightseeing Tour of Portland Maine
item.description: Visit Portland’s scenic coast, historic sites and most vibrant neighborhoods with a sightseeing and shopping tour on a classic fire engine. Get great views of picture-perfect lighthouses and architecture from high up on the engine, and listen to live narration as you tour the city. Learn about Portland’s maritime past as you explore cobblestone streets with enjoy plenty of time to browse souvenir shops and sample the area’s most distinctive foods. Finish your tour in the heart of downtown, near historic wharves, restaurants and boutiques.

image.alt: Vintage Fire Truck Sightseeing Tour of Portland Maine

item.title: Discover Portland City and Lighthouse Tour
item.description: Get more out of your time in Portland with this two-for-one adventure: a city trolley tour and lighthouse visit. You'll start with a narrated trolley journey, witnessing the most beloved sights of the Portland peninsula. After catching the Portland Observatory, the Wadsworth-Longfellow House, and more, you’ll then visit the city’s most famous landmark: Portland Head Light, Maine’s oldest—and most photographed—lighthouse.

image.alt: Discover Portland City and Lighthouse Tour

item.title: Premium Narrated Bus Tour of Bar Harbor and Acadia National Park (3.5 Hours)
item.description: Known for its rocky coastlines, wealth of wildlife, and evergreen forests, Acadia National Park promises dramatic scenery—and this fully narrated driving tour makes for an easy way to discover it. Set off from Bar Harbor in a luxury Berkshire minibus, and discover highlights like Cadillac Mountain (the highest point on the East Coast), Thunder Hole (where ocean waves roar), Sieur De Mont's Spring, Jordan Pond, and much more.

image.alt: Premium Narrated Bus Tour of Bar Harbor and Acadia National Park (3.5 Hours)

item.title: Harbor Lights and Sights Cruise
item.description: Half maritime adventure, half sightseeing exploration, the best way to catch Portland’s history is from the water. Gliding along Diamond Pass, you’ll catch views of Civil War–era forts, historic lighthouses, and likely some lobster boats bobbing in the breeze. Perfect for all ages, you’ll get to know the city and its maritime heritage, all while taking in its most scenic side.

image.alt: Harbor Lights and Sights Cruise

item.title: A Walk Through Time Tour in Portland
item.description: Learn about Portland's history with this walking tour, which will take you through the Old Port, downtown, and waterfront areas. You'll see all sorts of historic attractions, including the home of Hendry Wadsworth-Longfellow, the Eastern Cemetery, and the Abyssinian Church, all with a professional guide on hand to share stories about the city's past.

image.alt: A Walk Through Time Tour in Portland

item.title: Portland, Maine: Hidden Histories Guided Walking Tour
item.description: With this small-group walking tour, you'll go beyond coffee and craft beer and get a look at the true Portland, Maine—across 400 years of history. Meander downtown and the Old Port, visiting hidden landmarks and learning about Wabanaki leaders and other people and events left out of the history books. Discover centuries of destruction, revival, underrepresented perspectives, and other elements that mainstream tours gloss over.

image.alt: Portland, Maine: Hidden Histories Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Old Port Culinary Walking Tour from Portland
item.description: Food lovers can explore Portland's historic Old Port independently, but to uncover the best places serving traditional local fare, you really need a guide to lead the way. Taste the best that Portland has to offer on this guided foodie walking tour, complete with stops at up to seven different eateries—and enough tastings to replace a meal. Along the way, your guide offers some stories about Portland's food scene, so you can get familiar with the local culinary stalwarts.

image.alt: Old Port Culinary Walking Tour from Portland

item.title: Windjammer Classic Day Sail from Camden, Maine
item.description: Cruise Camden’s scenic coast aboard the Appledore II, a historic wooden schooner that's a thrilling taste of traditional Maine sailing. You can take the helm, raise the sails, or just find a comfortable spot on deck; an environmentally-friendly alternative to motorized Camden cruises, this sailing tour is a great way to explore the coast with just the sounds of the wind, sails, and sea to keep you company.

image.alt: Windjammer Classic Day Sail from Camden, Maine

item.title: Windjammer Classic Sunset Sail from Camden, Maine
item.description: Enjoy a one-of-a-kind perspective on Maine’s picture-perfect sunsets when you embark on an evening sailing tour. Departing from the scenic Camden Harbor, you’ll travel in comfort aboard a large, elegant windjammer that was built according to traditional methods. Sail past Curtis Island Light, chart Penobscot Bay, and take in the ruggedly beautiful coastal scenery, with views of mountains in the distance. You can spot local wildlife, enjoy drinks on board (available for purchase), and see the sun set over the water before returning to the harbor.

image.alt: Windjammer Classic Sunset Sail from Camden, Maine

item.title: Self-Guided Ebike Tours of Acadia National Park Carriage Roads
item.description: If you’re planning to explore Acadia National Park but would like to do so on your own time without a group holding you back, this Acadia National Park e-bike Rental is the perfect solution. This e-bike rental gives you an e-bike and all the equipment you need for a day roaming the park’s carriage roads, as well as Park Loop Road. Plus, with an e-bike, you decide when to be active.

image.alt: Self-Guided Ebike Tours of Acadia National Park Carriage Roads

item.title: 3 Hour Private Tour: Explore all the top spots of Acadia!
item.description: Make the most of your visit to Maine's Acadia National Park during this private, half-day guided tour. Find routes and trails that are difficult to locate for most visitors. Cover the Park Loop Road, with panoramic views from Cadillac Mountain. Tours include snacks, refreshments, and private transfers in a climate-controlled vehicle.

image.alt: 3 Hour Private Tour: Explore all the top spots of Acadia!

item.title: Portland Tall Ship Cruise on Casco Bay
item.description: See a new vantage on Portland and the Maine coast—and enjoy a relaxing excursion out on the water—on this sailing tour. Make your own way to the Maine State Pier, and hop aboard a traditional, Maine-built windjammer. Once you set sail, soak up the sea breezes, look out for seals, and even take a turn at hoisting the sails or behind the ship’s wheel.

image.alt: Portland Tall Ship Cruise on Casco Bay

item.title: 4 Hour Private Tour: Explore Acadia Nat'l Park, Fjord & Mansions
item.description: Explore the highlights of Maine's Acadia National Park during this private, half-day guided tour. Get personalized recommendations and information from your tour guide. Cover the Park Loop Road, with panoramic views from Cadillac Mountain—no climbing necessary. Tours include private transfers in a climate-controlled vehicle.

image.alt: 4 Hour Private Tour: Explore Acadia Nat'l Park, Fjord & Mansions

item.title: Guided Ebike Tour of Acadia National Park Carriage Roads
item.description: Join our guided 22-mile tour of the Acadia National Park Carriage Roads on a high-quality class 1 e-bike. Our experienced tour guides are the only ones authorized to take you on this tour within the park. You will learn about the different land features, the history of the Carriage Roads, and the must-see sights along the way. We guarantee that this guided tour will help you make unforgettable memories during your vacation.

image.alt: Guided Ebike Tour of Acadia National Park Carriage Roads

item.title: Lighthouse Lovers Cruise in Portland
item.description: Experience Portland's rich history from its most impressive vantage point: the water. Adventuring along Diamond Pass, you'll glimpse a Civil War–era fort, old-school lobster boats, and all the lighthouses Portland is so famous for, including Portland Head Light, Maine’s oldest. Suitable for all ages, this excursion is both a dive into Portland's past and a sightseeing adventure, a two-fer that’s leisurely, scenic, and fun.

image.alt: Lighthouse Lovers Cruise in Portland

item.title: 6 Hour Private Tour: Acadia National Park, Fjord & Lobster Lunch
item.description: Discover top sights within Acadia National Park with your own personal guide during this private, half-day tour. Cover more locations in less time in a comfortable, climate-controlled vehicle. Highlights include Park Loop Road and panoramic views from Cadillac Mountain. Tours include a stroll through Asticou Gardens, and a tasty lunch stop in Southwest Harbor (meal not included.)

image.alt: 6 Hour Private Tour: Acadia National Park, Fjord & Lobster Lunch

item.title: Savor Bar Harbor Culinary Walking Tour in Maine
item.description: Stroll through Bar Harbor with a small group on this tour focused on the local cuisine. As you walk, listen to in-depth commentary on the local food scene and stop for tastings at establishments around the Village Green. The tastings add up to a satisfying lunch, and the small group size means you'll have plenty of personalized attention and chances to ask questions.

image.alt: Savor Bar Harbor Culinary Walking Tour in Maine

item.title: Old Port "Seafood Lovers" Walking Lunch Tour in Portland, Maine
item.description: Maine is known for its seafood, and with this tour, you'll get to learn all about the industry, with the chance to sample some local delicacies along the way. You'll take a walk along the waterfront where lobster boats dock to unload their catches before heading out to a lunch of lobster rolls served with clam or seafood chowder and craft beer or soda pop.

image.alt: Old Port "Seafood Lovers" Walking Lunch Tour in Portland, Maine

item.title: Acadia Full Day Small Group Tour
item.description: Explore the beauty of a national park with the help of a naturalist guide to teach you all about the flora and fauna of the area’s land and sea. You’ll enjoy a mixture of hiking on and off the beaten track, and traveling in a comfortable, air-conditioned van. You’ll be walking and learning in an intimate group where you can pick the tour leader’s brain to your heart’s content.

image.alt: Acadia Full Day Small Group Tour

item.title: Portland Delicious Donut Adventure & Walking Food Tour
item.description: A taste of the Northeast like no other, this fun and flavorful tour showcases some of the best donuts in Portland, Maine. Follow your guide around the streets of Portland in search of the sweet spots that locals love the most. This walking tour takes you around the Old Port to three of downtown’s donut shops where you’ll try six unique samples.

image.alt: Portland Delicious Donut Adventure & Walking Food Tour

item.title: Portland Bicycle Tour with 5 Lighthouse Stops and XL Lobster Roll
item.description: Discover the lighthouses and coastal landmarks of Portland on a small-group biking tour. Hop on a provided bicycle and follow your guide to the Bug Light, Spring Point Ledge, and Portland Head lighthouses. Along the way, learn about their storied histories. Other highlights include the Liberty Ship Memorial, Cape Elizabeth, and Willard Beach. Set at a leisurely pace, the adventure also includes a complimentary lobster roll lunch at an award-winning food truck.

image.alt: Portland Bicycle Tour with 5 Lighthouse Stops and XL Lobster Roll

item.title: Portland, Maine: Black History Guided Walking Tour
item.description: Maine's Black community is small, but its history here goes back more than 400 years. On this guided tour, you’ll dive deep into Portland’s Black history, discovering how this community—national leaders, laborers, skilled workers, activists, and more—fought for freedom and equality and defined the state's path. From Frederick Douglass to lesser-known Black Yankees, there’s far more here than meets the eye, and with this tour, you’ll learn all about it.

image.alt: Portland, Maine: Black History Guided Walking Tour
